sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使适合，适应"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: adapt, adjust, conform, accommodate, suit, fit
means: adapt ：指人或物在原有情况下作某些改变以适应新的环境或不同的条件，强调改变的目的和重要性。
adjust与adapt含义很接近，但adjust所改变的幅度要小一些，侧重过程，主要用于调整角度、高度、光点等。
conform ：多指与某模式或规则相符，也引申指改变习惯等以适应新的环境。
accommodate ：书面用词，指以外部条件标准改变自己或某事以求得适应，着重改变或调节的有利。
suit ：指适合要求，从而使人满意愉快。
fit ：含义广，指人或物适合或适应某一目的或用途。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"衣服，服装"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: clothes, clothing, coat, dress, garment, robe, gown, uniform, costume, suit
means: clothes ： 普通用词，多指包括上衣、内衣或裤子等具体的一件件衣服。
clothing ： 常用词，集合名词，是衣服的总称。
coat ： 指上衣、外衣、大衣、外套及女式上装。
dress ： 多指正式场合或为某些特定用途而穿的服装，也指童装或女性穿的连衣裙。
garment ： 语气庄重，正式用词，复数形式可与clothes换用，指身上全部穿着。单数形式指单件衣服，尤指长袍、外套等外面的衣服。
robe ： 指长袍，也指浴衣、晨衣。
gown ： 指女人穿的长服，尤指教士、法官、教授等的礼服或妇女的睡衣等，也指长袍。
uniform ： 指某团体或组织统一做的制服，如军服、校服等。
costume ： 指流行某一地区或某一时代的服装，也指演员的戏装。
suit ： 指一套服装，一般有几件配成一套的套装。

sentence.Network_en: These large institutions make — and change—the rules to suit themselves.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些大机构总是随意制定规定，而且说变就变。

sentence.Network_en: Choose a soft, medium or firm mattress to suit their individual needs.
sentence.Network_cn: 针对他们各人不同的需要挑选柔软、软硬适中或者坚硬的床垫。

sentence.Network_en: She was demurely dressed in a black woollen suit.
sentence.Network_cn: 她穿了一身黑色羊毛套装，显得很庄重。

phrase.cizu_name: suit the action to the word

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)be convenient or acceptable to someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)对…方便（或合适)，合…的意

phrase.cizu_name: suit someone down to the ground

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)be extremely convenient or appropriate for someone
To put on clothing designed for a special activity
jx.jx_cn_mean: 装，穿上特种用途的全套衣装

lj.lj_ly: suits up in shorts for a jog.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French siwte, from a feminine past participle of a Romance verb based on Latin sequi 'follow'. Early senses included 'attendance at a court' and 'legal process'; senses 1 and 2 derive from an earlier meaning 'set of things to be used together'. The verb sense 'make appropriate' dates from the late 16th cent

entry.def: A man's suit consists of a jacket, trousers, and sometimes a waistcoat, all made from the same fabric.
A woman's suit consists of a jacket and skirt, or sometimes trousers, made from the same fabric.

example.ex: I was wearing my tweed suit.

entry.tran: (从事特定活动时穿的)成套服装
entry.def: A particular type of suit is a piece of clothing that you wear for a particular activity.

example.tran: 令人耳目一新的大气压潜水服

entry.tran: 对…方便;满足…需要;合…心意
entry.def: If something suits you, it is convenient for you or is the best thing for you in the circumstances.

example.ex: They will only release information if it suits them...
example.tran: 他们只会发布对他们有利的信息。

example.ex: They should be able to find you the best package to suit your needs.
example.tran: 他们应该能提供满足你需要的最佳套餐。

entry.def: If something suits you, you like it.

example.ex: I don't think a sedentary life would altogether suit me.
example.tran: 我认为长期伏案的生活一点也不适合我。

entry.tran: (服装、风格、颜色)使显得漂亮，与…相配;适合
entry.def: If a piece of clothing or a particular style or colour suits you, it makes you look attractive.

entry.tran: 随自己的意愿;随性子;自便
entry.def: If you suit yourself, you do something just because you want to do it, without bothering to consider other people.

example.ex: These large institutions make — and change—the rules to suit themselves...
example.tran: 这些大机构总是随意制定规定，而且说变就变。

example.ex: He made a dismissive gesture. 'Suit yourself.'
example.tran: 他做了一个很不屑的手势。“随你便。”

entry.def: In a court of law, a suit is a case in which someone tries to get a legal decision against a person or company, often so that the person or company will have to pay them money for having done something wrong to them.

example.ex: Up to 2,000 former employees have filed personal injury suits against the company...
example.tran: 多达 2,000 名旧职员以个人伤害为由向该公司提起诉讼。

entry.def: A suit is one of the four types of card in a set of playing cards. These are hearts, diamonds, clubs, and spades.
If people follow suit, they do the same thing that someone else has just done.

example.ex: Efforts to persuade the remainder to follow suit have continued.
example.tran: 说服其余人跟着效仿的努力仍在继续。

entry.def: If something suits you down to the ground, you like it a great deal or find it very convenient.

example.ex: Their London house suits them down to the ground.
example.tran: 他们在伦敦的房子很合他们心意。

means.word_mean: 1. a comprehensive term for any proceeding in a court of law whereby an individual seeks a legal remedy;

sentences.sentence: "the family brought suit against the landlord"

means.word_mean: 2. a set of garments (usually including a jacket and trousers or skirt) for outerwear all of the same fabric and color;

sentences.sentence: "they buried him in his best suit"

means.word_mean: 3. playing card in any of four sets of 13 cards in a pack; each set has its own symbol and color;

sentences.sentence: "a flush is five cards in the same suit"

means.word_mean: 4. a businessman dressed in a business suit;

sentences.sentence: "all the suits care about is the bottom line"

means.word_mean: 5. a man's courting of a woman; seeking the affections of a woman (usually with the hope of marriage);

sentences.sentence: "its was a brief and intense courtship"

means.word_mean: 6. a petition or appeal made to a person of superior status or rank

sentences.sentence: "This kind of behavior does not suit a young woman!"

auth_sentence.res_content: Other nations including the Bahamas have since followed suit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Other nations including the Bahamas have since followed suit.

auth_sentence.content: But they suit the mood of the album well.
auth_sentence.res_content: But they suit the mood of the album well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they suit the mood of the album well.

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Havey dropped the suit a few weeks later.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Havey dropped the suit a few weeks later.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Havey dropped the suit a few weeks later.

stems_affixes.word_buile: suit[v.合适, 适合, 相配]+able……的→adj.适当的, 相配的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不适合的, 不相称的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+suitable[adj.适当的, 相配的]→adj.不适合的, 不相称的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 合适, 适合, 相配
stems_affixes.word_buile: su跟随,追+it走→跟在后面走→相配

Sentence.sentence: You can pick up your suit after five o'clock.

Just as peer-to-peer businesses like eBay allow anyone to become a retailer, sharing sites let individuals act as an ad hoc ( 临时的) taxi service, car-hire firm or boutique hotel (精品酒店) as and when it suits them.
Finally, I've got the chance to put on my new suit tonight.
It should be improved to better suit the job market.
After reading a book on how to address for success, he had purchased an expensive dark navy suit and golden tie.
Why did Larry purchase an expensive navy suit and golden tie

sentences.en: He changed his overalls for a suit.
sentences.cn: 他脱下工装裤, 换上了一套西服。

sentences.en: The piece of cloth will cut up into three suits.
sentences.cn: 这块布可以裁成三套衣服。

means.word_mean: 诉讼案件; 法律程序

sentences.en: She is the plaintiff in the suit.
sentences.cn: 她是那件诉讼案中的原告。

sentences.en: That song doesn't suit her voice.
sentences.cn: 那首歌不适合她的嗓子。

sentences.en: These styles can be adapted to suit individual tastes.
sentences.cn: 这些式样可以加以更改, 以适合个人的喜好。

sentences.en: All this suits my purpose very well.
It doesn't suit her to have her hair cut short.

jushi.english: He dressed in his best suit.
He changed his overalls for a suit.
jushi.chinese: 他脱下工装裤,换上了一套西服。

jushi.english: She filed a suit for divorce.
